{{Years in amusement parks navigation|2016}} This article is a list of '''events and openings related to amusement parks that occurred in 2016'''. These various lists are not exhaustive. ==Amusement parks== ===Opening=== *'''China''' [[Nanchang Wanda Park]] – May 27 *'''China''' [[Shanghai Disneyland Park|Shanghai Disneyland]] – June 16 *'''UAE''' [[IMG Worlds of Adventure]] – August 31 *'''UAE''' [[Legoland Dubai]] – October 31 *'''UAE''' [[Bollywood Parks Dubai]] – November 15 *'''UAE''' [[Motiongate Dubai]] – December 16 *'''United States''' [[Ark Encounter]] – July 7 ===Reopened=== *'''Italy''' [[LunEur]] – 2016 ===Birthday=== *'''[[Blackpool Pleasure Beach]]''' 120th birthday *'''[[California's Great America]]''' 40th birthday *'''[[Canada's Wonderland]]''' 35th birthday *'''[[Dreamworld (Australian theme park)|Dreamworld]]''' 35th birthday *'''[[Disney California Adventure]]''' 15th birthday *'''[[Downtown Disney]]''' 15th birthday *'''[[Gilroy Gardens]]''' 15th birthday *'''[[Lagoon Amusement Park]]''' 130th birthday *'''[[Toverland]]''' 15th birthday *'''[[Magic Kingdom]]''' 45th birthday *'''[[Michigan's Adventure]]''' 60th birthday *'''[[Sea World (Australia)|Sea World]] (Australia)''' 45th birthday *'''[[Six Flags Great America]]''' 40th birthday *'''[[Six Flags Magic Mountain]]''' 45th birthday *'''[[Six Flags Over Texas]]''' 55th birthday *'''[[Six Flags St. Louis]]''' 45th birthday *'''[[Valleyfair]]''' 40th birthday *'''[[Warner Bros Movie World]]''' 25th birthday *'''[[Whitewater World]]''' 10th birthday ===Closed=== * [[Wet 'n Wild Orlando]] – December 31 * [[Wildwater Kingdom (Aurora, OH)|Wildwater Kingdom]] – September 5 * [[Pleasure Island Family Theme Park]] – October 29 ==Additions== ===Roller coasters=== ====New==== {|class="wikitable sortable" |- ! {{Infobox film | name = 2 Jennifer | image = | alt = | caption = | film name = | director = Hunter Johnson | producer = | writer = Hunter Johnson | screenplay = | story = | based on = | starring = Hunter Johnson
David Coupe
Lara Jean Mummert | narrator = | music = Mo Bluntz | cinematography = Hunter Johnson | editing = Frank Merle | production companies = LAHorror.com
Sector 5 Films | distributors = Gravitas Ventures
[[Reality Entertainment]]
Sector 5 Films | released = {{Film date|2016|6|3}} | runtime = 84 minutes | country = United States | language = English | budget = | gross = }} '''''2 Jennifer''''' is a 2016 indie [[horror film]] written and directed by Hunter Johnson, who also stars in the film.{{Cite web|url=http://horrornews.net/109848/film-review-2-jennifer-2016/|title=Film Review: 2 Jennifer (2016)|last=|first=|date=|website=HorrorNews.net|language=en-US|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-04-18}} The film is a sequel to [[James Cullen Bressack|James Cullen Bressack's]] ''[[To Jennifer]]'' and features Johnson as a young man intent on creating a sequel to the 2013 film.{{Cite news|url=http://www.dreadcentral.com/news/101088/james-cullen-bressack-hunter-johnson-prepping-2-jennifer/|title=James Cullen Bressack and Hunter Johnson Prepping 2 Jennifer|last=Rigney|first=Todd|date=2015-05-11|work=Dread Central|access-date=2017-04-18|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en-US}} ==Synopsis== Spencer wants to create a sequel to one of his favorite horror films, ''To Jennifer,'' and is hoping that doing so will launch his career as a filmmaker. As such, he is playing one of the movie's main characters and wants to find the perfect woman to serve as the film's titular character, even going so far as to insist that they only consider actresses that are named Jennifer. However as they find their perfect Jennifer and filming commences, Spencer's hold on reality grows more and more tenuous. ==Cast== *Hunter Johnson as Spencer *David Coupe as Mack *Lara Jean Mummert as Jennifer *[[Felissa Rose]] as Jennifer Smith *[[Erin Marie Hogan]] as Jennifer Johnson *Veronica Ricci sa Jennifer Martin *Jody Barton as Jody *[[James Cullen Bressack]] as James *Jarrett Furst as Jarrett *Josh Brown as Josh *Charles Chudabala as Charlie *Matt Holbrook as Dennis *Chrissy Cannone as Susan *Marv Blauvelt as Thumper *Erin Killean as Jennifer Corby ==Reception== ''[[Starburst (magazine)|Starburst]]'' wrote a favorable review of the movie, as they felt that it was "refreshing to have a sequel work so well and for it actually not be essential that one has seen the original. Ultimately, it’s a more enjoyable ride than the first, with a payoff that packs quite a wallop."{{Cite web|url=http://www.starburstmagazine.com/reviews/dvd-and-blu-ray-home-entertainment-reviews/17167-2-jennifer-review|title=2 JENNIFER|last=UNSWORTH|first=MARTIN|date=|website=Starburst|language=en-gb|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-04-18}} In contrast, [[Dread Central]] panned ''2 Jennifer'', stating that "Fans of bargain-basement snuff will eat this one right up, but for this lad, I prefer to keep my eyesight on level ground… solid, stable, non-shaky ground."{{Cite news|url=http://www.dreadcentral.com/reviews/182543/2-jennifer-2016/|title=2 Jennifer (2016) - Dread Central|last=Boiselle|first=Matt|date=2016-08-19|work=Dread Central|access-date=2017-04-18|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en-US}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{IMDb title|4627224}} {{Jennifer series}} [[Category:2016 horror films]] [[Category:Found footage films]] [[Category:American comedy horror films]] [[Category:American films]] [[Category:2010s comedy horror films]]

It was launched in 2009. The channel is available through Express AM22 satellite, [[Turksat 3A]] [[satellite]]. It also has a radio station available in Afghanistan.Arzu tv format is [[Standard-definition television|SD]]&[[High-definition television|HD]]. ==External links== * [http://www.arzu.tv/ ARZU TV - Official website] {{DEFAULTSORT:Arzu Tv}} [[Category:Television in Afghanistan]] [[Category:Television channels and stations disestablished in 2009]] {{Asia-tv-stub}} {{Afghanistan-media-stub}}

/* Transformers Cinematic Universe */
revision.text:
'''Blackout''' is the name of six [[fictional]] robot supervillan characters from the [[Transformers]] robot superhero franchise. ==Transformers: Generation 1== {{Transformers character| name =Blackout |image =blackout-g1.jpg |caption =Blackout in Dreamwave comics |affiliation =Decepticon |subgroup =Micromaster |function =Ground infantry |partner =Spaceshot |motto = |alternatemodes =Half a [[B-1B Lancer]] bomber jet |series =''[[Transformers: Generation 1]] '' |engvoice = }} Blackout was one of a team of two Micromaster Combiners. They came with a [[Flugabwehrkanonenpanzer Gepard|Gepard]] air defense vehicle that could transform to a base. Because Blackout and his partner [[Spaceshot (Transformers)|Spaceshot]] are regularly pictured together and that they are amongst the lesser-known Micromasters, the exact identity of each Transformer is regularly mistaken for the other.{{Cite book | title=Transformers: The Fantasy, The Fun, The Future| last=Brereton | first=Erin | year=2006 | publisher=Triumph Books| ISBN=1572439831 | page= 12}} ===Dreamwave Productions=== Blackout has never appeared in Transformers fiction, except for a profile in [[Dreamwave Productions]]' ''[[Transformers: More Than Meets the Eye]]'' series. His bio painted him as a brave Decepticon warrior, but liable to flee if the odds turned against him. Only Spaceshot's disapproval often keeps this from happening. ===Toys=== *'''''Generation 1'' Micromaster Blackout and Spaceshot''' (1990) :{{cite web |url=http://www.bwtf.com/tfg1/toys/reviews/micromasters/antiaircraft/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2006-08-22 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070920135703/http://www.bwtf.com/tfg1/toys/reviews/micromasters/antiaircraft/ |archivedate=2007-09-20 |df= }} {{-}} ==Transformers: Armada== {{Transformers character| name =Blackout |japanname =Search |image = |caption = |affiliation =Mini-Con |subgroup = |function = |partner =[[Demolishor]] |motto ="''Sometimes your inner voice is the best leader.''" |alternatemodes =Mobile missile platform |series =''[[Transformers: Armada]]''
''[[Transformers: Energon]]'' |voiceby = }} Blackout is the Mini-Con partner of Demolishor. ===Animated series=== In the cartoon, Demolishor used him to find other [[Mini-Con]]s. ===Dreamwave Productions=== Blackout appeared among the Mini-Cons in issue #18 of the ''Transformers: Armada'' comic book who aided [[Over-Run]] using the [[Mini-Con Matrix]] in the defeat of Unicron. Blackout's bio painted him as aggressive and independent—something which contrasts with [[Demolishor]]'s blind loyalty to [[Megatron (Unicron Trilogy)|Megatron]]. He would voice his thoughts and feelings, even at the risk of a severe beating. ===Toys=== *'''''Armada'' Mini-Con Blackout''' (2002) :Blackout was one of the first-released Mini-Cons that were included with a larger Transformer. Blackout was able to attach to [[Demolishor]] to form the front section of the Decepticon's tank mode, or he was able to sit on the seat on Demolishor's back. When attached to a special Mini-Con port, he can fire Demolishor's shoulder missiles.{{cite web |url=http://www.bwtf.com/armada/toys/reviews/demolishor/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2006-08-24 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060516113436/http://www.bwtf.com/armada/toys/reviews/demolishor/ |archivedate=2006-05-16 |df= }} *'''''Armada'' Mini-Con Powerlinx Blackout''' :He was later recolored when Demolishor received his [[Powerlink (Transformers)|Powerlinx]] upgrade.{{cite web |url=http://www.bwtf.com/armada/toys/reviews/powerlinx/demolishor/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2006-08-24 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060516114443/http://www.bwtf.com/armada/toys/reviews/powerlinx/demolishor/ |archivedate=2006-05-16 |df= }} *'''''Armada'' Built to Rule Blackout''' (2003–2004) :Blackout was also part of the [[Built to Rule]] toy line, again as Demolishor's partner, and during 2004, he was recolored with a 'Night Attack' scheme which was not based on an existing Transformers toy. In the [[Japan]]ese series, Blackout was named '''Search''' and later '''Spark Search''' when he was recolored. *'''''Energon'' Mini-Con Blackout''' (2004) :Ten years after the events in ''Armada'', Demolishor retained his original form, only with a new color scheme. Blackout also received a new color scheme to match Demolishor's. However, Blackout did not appear in the ''Energon'' animated series. Blackout did not reappear when the ''Armada'' Demolishor toy was repainted for ''[[Transformers: Cybertron]]''.[http://www.seibertron.com/toys/gallery.php?id=308&size=0&start= Blackout - Transformers: Energon - Toy Gallery - Photos 1 - 24] ==Transformers: Energon== {{Transformers character| name =Blackout |japanname =Blast Off |image =Blackout-energontoy.jpg |caption =''Energon'' Blackout toy |affiliation =Decepticon |subgroup =Destruction Team |function =Aerial Staff Officer |partner =Barricade, Blight, Kickback, and Stormcloud |motto = |alternatemodes =[[AH-64 Apache]] |series =''[[Transformers: Energon]]'' |voiceby = }} Blackout was a member of the Decepticon Destruction Team and transformed into a [[helicopter]]. He was able to combine with his team to form a limb of the giant robot, [[Bruticus Maximus]]. ===Animated series=== In the ''Energon'' animated series, Blackout was a seemingly non-sentient drone commanded by team leader, [[Barricade (Transformers)|Barricade]]. As with all of the Energon combiner limbs, Blackout has a twin brother on his team—Stormcloud. Their energon weapons were a cannon and a pair of guns. In the Japanese series, each member had the name of a ''Generation 1'' [[Combaticon]]—Blackout's name was [[Blast Off (Transformers)|Blast Off]]. ===Dreamwave Productions=== Although the ''Transformers: Energon'' comic book series by Dreamwave Productions was canceled before Blackout could appear in them, the Energon "More Than Meets The Eye" guide book was under development at the time. Pencil art by [[Guido Guidi]] was released later showing the art that would have been used with Blackout's profile. ===Toys=== *'''''Energon'' Basic Blackout''' (2005) :Shared a mold with Storm Cloud. Later redecoed into ''Timelines'' [[Topspin (Transformers)|Topspin]].[http://www.seibertron.com/toys/gallery.php?id=349&size=0&start=0 Blast Off (Blackout) - Superlink - Toy Gallery - Photos 1 - 25] {{-}} ==Transformers Cinematic Universe== {{Transformers character| name =Blackout |image =Blackout (1).png |caption =Blackout in the [[Transformers (film)|2007 Transformers movie]] |affiliation =Decepticon |subgroup =Fast Action Battlers, Micro Vehicles, Voyagers, Cybertron Defense Force |rank =9 |function =First strike soldier, Warrior, Demolition Expert, Third-in-Command |partner =[[Scorponok#Transformers|Scorponok]], [[Megatron]], [[Barricade#Transformers|Barricade]] |motto = "''He who cares for the opinions of others is lost.''" |alternatemode's =[[MH-53 Pave Low]] [[helicopter]], Cybertronian spacecraft |series =''[[Transformers (film series)|Transformers film series]]'' |engvoice =[[Brian Stepanek]] ([[Transformers: Movie Prequel#Animated Adaption|animated prequel]])
Noah Nelson ([[Transformers: The Game|video game]]) |japanvoice = }} Early leaked scripts of the 2007 [[Transformers (film)|live-action film]] had a Decepticon helicopter named [[Vortex (Transformers)|Vortex]], after the ''Generation 1'' [[Combaticon]]. Possibly due to Hasbro's lack of a trademark on the name Vortex, they changed the name to Blackout. Blackout has had various names before being finalized—[[Soundwave (Transformers)|Soundwave]], [[Vortex (Transformers)|Vortex]] and Incinerator; all names have been used on a Transformers toy at some point before. Leaked concept art for the character had the name "Incinerator" on it. [[File:Airmen at filming of Transformers at Holloman AFB 2006-05-30.jpg|thumb|left|Blackout in the 2007 movie]] [[image:Blackout-soundwave.jpg|left|thumb|Early Blackout design]] Blackout transforms into an [[MH-53 Pave Low|Sikorsky MH-53 Pave Low]] helicopter. According to screenwriters [[Roberto Orci]] and [[Alex Kurtzman]], Blackout is the largest Decepticon. Blackout is armed with rotary machine guns and energon wave cannons. He is also able to detach and wield his tail rotor blades as a close-combat weapon. According to the book ''Transformers: The Movie Universe'', Blackout's rotor weapon can spin at 6,000 rpm and is reinforced with toughened cobalt. When out of vehicle mode his main rotors fold into two sets of three onto his back, giving him the appearance of having wings. When in helicopter mode he can simulate the appearance of a human pilot, the same holographic model (referred to as "Mustache Man" on-set and in the credits) that "pilots" [[Starscream (Transformers)|Starscream]] and "drives" [[Barricade (Transformers)#2007 Transformers film|Barricade]]. Blackout can carry [[Scorponok#Transformers|Scorponok]] on his back, as seen in both the film and the game.[http://www.hasbro.com/transformers/default.cfm?page=Entertainment/Bios&transformer=Blackout transformers-fr_FR - default] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070922075445/http://www.hasbro.com/transformers/default.cfm?page=Entertainment%2FBios&transformer=Blackout |date=September 22, 2007 }} According to his profile in the second issue of the U.K. Transformers magazine, Blackout stands 33 feet 5 inches tall, weighs 2.9 tons and has a maximum speed of 800 mph. The official guide to the Transformers video game says he's 33 feet tall. Both of these heights are much smaller than his alternate mode would suggest, and seem to contradict what Roberto Orci and Alex Kurtzman said about his size. However, in the video game's profile for him, it states that he is often seen "silently looming over Megatron's shoulder" indicating that he would have to be taller than Megatron, and therefore taller than 33 feet. His exact height seems to be a mystery. As size calculations from the Voyager class toy suggests, his height should be about 55 feet tall. Oddly the book ''Ghosts of Yesterday'' described him as being smaller than Optimus Prime, who is officially described as 28 feet tall. ===Books=== Blackout appeared in the prequel novel, ''[[Transformers: Ghosts of Yesterday]]'', where he was the most vocal critic of [[Starscream (Transformers)|Starscream]]'s leadership. When Starscream left to destroy [[Bumblebee (Transformers)|Bumblebee]], Blackout seized the initiative and led [[Bonecrusher (Transformers)|Bonecrusher]], Scorponok and [[Frenzy (Transformers)|Frenzy]] in an assault on the Autobots, attacking Prime. He failed, and eventually challenged Starscream to a duel for leadership of the Decepticons, which he lost. The book ''Transformers - Meet The Decepticons'' by [[Jennifer Frantz]] had a slightly different ending than the movie. This book had all six Decepticons leaving Earth together after being defeated by the Autobots, instead of having most of their numbers die. The back cover to children's book "Transformers Prime Time" by [[Michael Teitelbaum]] called Blackout by his earlier name Vortex on the back cover, but used Blackout in the book. ===Comics=== ====IDW Publishing==== Blackout appeared in ''[[Transformers: Defiance]]'' by [[IDW Publishing]]. In issue #2 he sided with Megatron in his decision to counter-attack Cybertron's invaders and was among the fleet that attacked their ships. Blackout also appeared in [[IDW Publishing]]'s ''[[Transformers: Movie Prequel|movie prequel comic]]'', where he, Starscream and [[Barricade (Transformers)#2007 Transformers film|Barricade]] smashed up the [[Mars]] [[Beagle 2]] probe. In issue 4, he traveled to Earth, where he gained his MH-53 helicopter mode in [[Afghanistan]] and destroyed the scanned vehicle. The three Decepticons, detecting emissions similar to that of the [[Spark (Transformers)#2007 Transformers film|Allspark]], then stumbled onto Sector 7's trap for [[Bumblebee (Transformers)#2007 Transformers film|Bumblebee]], wiping out their military backup. Blackout tried to access Sector 7's computers, but could only glean a few bits of information before they shut it down. After Barricade outlined his plan to follow Bumblebee and see what they could find out, Blackout and Starscream tailed him from the air. In ''[[Transformers: Alliance]]'' #2 the bodies of Brawl, Blackout and Megatron are seen being loaded onto trucks at the Nevada desert for disposal in the ocean. ====Titan Magazines==== Information in ''italics'' occur in the alternate storyline where Megatron won the battle for the Allspark. Blackout appeared in issue #7 if the Transformers Titan Magazine in a story called "Starscream's Militia". He was seemingly brought to life by Starscream using the sparks of Allspark mutations. He was immediately killed again by the Autobots. ''Blackout appears in issue #22 of the Titan Transformers Magazine series in a story called "The Decepticon who Haunted Himself."'' ''Blackout and Scorponok were killed by Stockade for rejecting his offer to defect to Stockade's side.'' ===Films=== In the 2007 [[Transformers (film)|live-action film]], Blackout is the first active [[Decepticon]] (and first Transformer) to be seen. Blackout serves as the right hand of Megatron in the movie. He is Third-in-Command after Megatron and Starscream. Early in the film, he, along with his [[henchman|minion]] [[Scorponok#Transformers|Scorponok]], attacks the [[SOCCENT]] Forward Operations Center in [[Qatar]], disguised as a [[Sikorsky MH-53|MH-53M Pave Low IV]] helicopter, tail number 4500X, that was apparently shot down over [[Afghanistan]] three months earlier. Blackout is escorted to the base by two [[Lockheed Martin F-22 Raptor|F-22 Raptor]]s, where he transforms and single-handedly destroys the whole base. During his attack, he attempts to hack into the base's system to download data on the location of the [[Allspark#2007 Transformers movie|Allspark]] and [[Megatron (Transformers)#Transformers|Megatron]], only to have the hardline to the system cut off by a military officer. He then deploys Scorponok and send him to after a fleeing Captain William Lennox and his team. Later, Blackout is seen rallying with the other Decepticons to [[Starscream]]'s call, after [[Frenzy (Transformers)#2007 Transformers movie|Frenzy]] discovers the Allspark in the [[Hoover Dam]], saying "All hail Megatron" as if to remind Starscream who his master is. Arriving in Mission City during the final battle, Blackout attacks Sam, who is saved by the timely intervention of [[Ironhide]], who throws a car at Blackout, which the Decepticon blasts out of the way and then he shoots down Ironhide. Later he attempts to kill Sam with his rotor weapon, but misses him by a few feet. Towards the end of the battle he attempts to help Megatron finish off [[Optimus Prime (other incarnations)#2007 Transformers film|Optimus Prime]]; however, he is attacked by Captain Lennox and his team, the former racing underneath him on a motorcycle and firing at him with a sabot round, along with human pilots in F-22 Raptors firing a barrage of missiles from the air, eventually killing him. (The events of "Starscream's Militia" and ''Alliance'' issue #2 occur next.) His corpse is disposed of in the [[Laurentian Abyss]], along with Megatron and the other [[Bonecrusher (Transformers)|fallen]] [[Brawl (Transformers)|Decepticons]]. In ''Revenge of the Fallen'' a similar looking Decepticon named '''Grindor''' appears assisting Megatron and the Doctor in taking the All Spark fragment from Sam. Grindor is later killed by Optimus Prime during an attempt to rescue Sam. ===Games=== In ''Transformers: The Game'', Blackout appears as a playable character in the Decepticon campaign. He stands very tall over the other Transformers and is very powerful. In the Autobot campaign, he appeared in Jazz's battle with Starscream but was killed. Starscream betrays Blackout and flies away. In the Decepticon campaign, Blackout is used in many missions, including the First Mission and Fourth Mission. He also killed Ironhide. During Megatron's battle with Optimus Prime, Blackout attempted to assist his master by charging Prime. Prime punched the massive Decepticon, sending him flying. He was knocked out by Optimus Prime but was not killed. After that, Blackout went back to the new Decepticon base with other Decepticons to destroy the planet and execute the Autobots and humans. It should also be noted that it can be argued that Blackout is the best playable Transformer in the game, being able to kill almost every drone type in one melee strike, and can kill many at a time in multiple directions. Also, his heavy ranged weapon can get through the red drone's shield, making him the only playable Transformer who can do that, and the strike actually deals considerable damage on a foe, unlike with most of the other playable characters. ===Toys=== All toys of this character are officially licensed from [[Sikorsky Aircraft]]. *'''''Transformers'' Legends Blackout''' (2007) :A 3-inch micro-sized Legends version of Blackout features a simple transformation and two free-spinning blades. *'''''Transformers'' Fast Action Battlers Gyro Blade Blackout''' (2007) :A Deluxe-sized toy with simplified transformation for younger children.[http://www.hasbro.com/transformers/default.cfm?page=Products/Detail&product_id=20285 transformers-fr_FR - default] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070929111533/http://www.hasbro.com/transformers/default.cfm?page=Products%2FDetail&product_id=20285 |date=September 29, 2007 }} *'''''Transformers'' Voyager Blackout''' (2007) :Features a spinning set of blades, whose mount can be removed to form a spinning-blade weapon for the robot mode. It also includes a small, non-transforming [[Scorponok]] figure with a spring-tail that can be dropped from a basket in Blackout's helicopter mode. In vehicle mode, Blackout can combine with the Deluxe Class movie Scorponok figure (sold separately) in a combined gimmick: rotating Blackout's rotors will cause Scorponok's claws to spin. Blackout lacks the arm-mounted weapons seen in the film, but his robot mode does have sculpted missiles detailed on its shoulders. It is the smallest Voyager-class sized figure, despite his actual size in the movie being larger than the others. The figure has features based on a concept art image rather than the actual character from the movie. :This toy's fuselage is 25 centimeters long, while an actual Pavelow helicopter is 2235 centimeters long. This gives it a scale of about 1/89. With a robot toy height of 19 centimeters, Blackout should stand about 55 feet tall. :This toy was later remolded into the Autobot [[Evac (Transformers)|Evac]]. :A 2-pack called "Desert Attack" was released in 2007 at [[Toys "R" Us]] with both Voyager Blackout and Deluxe Scorponok.GameAxis Unwired Jul 2007, p. 110{{cite news | author = | title = Profiles |work= Movie Toy Explosion! | quote = | publisher = ''Fun Publications'' | date = June–July 2007 | pages = 4–5| url = | accessdate =}} *'''''Transformers'' Legends Desert Blackout''' (2008) :A redeco of Movie Legends Blackout.[http://www.bigbadtoystore.com/bbts/product.aspx?product=HAS14334&mode=retail Movie Legends Battle Packs - Ironhide Vs. Desert Blackout - Transformers Movie 2007 Movie Legends at BigBadToyStore] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071105020759/http://www.bigbadtoystore.com/bbts/product.aspx?product=HAS14334&mode=retail |date=2007-11-05 }} *'''''Transformers'' Premium Voyager Blackout''' (2008) :A redeco of the Voyager Blackout with more movie-accurate detailing in vehicle mode.[http://www.hasbro.com/transformers/default.cfm?page=Products/Detail&product_id=21610 transformers-fr_FR - default] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080424130919/http://www.hasbro.com/transformers/default.cfm?page=Products%2FDetail&product_id=21610 |date=April 24, 2008 }} *'''''Revenge of the Fallen'' Titanium 3 inch Blackout''' (2009) :A repackage of the same toy from the 2007 movie toy line. He squares off against Ratchet.[http://www.allspark.com/gallery/album276/rotf_titanium_03_rescue_ratchet_vs_blackout AllSpark.com - ROTF Titanium Rescue Ratchet vs. Blackout]{{dead link|date=November 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} *'''''Revenge of the Fallen'' Robot Heroes Optimus Prime vs. Blackout''' (2009) :Small non-transforming figures which are targeted for smaller children. Optimus Prime vs Blackout.[http://www.digi-zap.com/catalog/optimus_blackout.gif Digi-Zap.com] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110710124242/http://www.digi-zap.com/catalog/optimus_blackout.gif |date=July 10, 2011 }} *'''''Dark of the Moon'' Cyberverse Commander Blackout with Scorponok''' (2011) :A new Commander Class mold. He may not be size accurate, but he does come with a tiny [[Scorponok]].[http://www.tfw2005.com/resources/cyberverse-decepticons-478/blackout-with-scorponok-5511/ TFW2005.com - Blackout with Scorponok] *'''''Transformers: Studios Series'' Leader Class Blackout with Scorponok''' (2018)[http://news.tfw2005.com/2017/12/19/transformers-movie-studio-series-upc-listings-355615] ===Non-transforming merchandise=== *'''''Transformers'' Blackout RC Helicopter''' (2007) :A [[RadioShack]] exclusive, this [[radio-controlled helicopter]] flies up to a range of 25 feet and is rechargeable using the supplied helipad. [https://web.archive.org/web/20070928010904/http://www.radioshack.com/product/index.jsp?productId=2793271&cp=&sr=1&origkw=transformer-sku-list&kw=transformer-sku-list&parentPage=search link] ==Transformers Animated== {{Transformers character| name = Blackout |japanname = |image = |caption = |affiliation = Decepticon |subgroup = |function = [[Shock and Awe]], Airborne Soldier |rank = 4 (Hasbro), 7 (Takara) |motto = "''Lights out.''" |alternatemodes = Cybertronian [[space craft]], helicopter |series = ''[[Transformers Animated]]'' | engvoice = [[Bumper Robinson]] | japanvoice =[[Kenta Miyake]] }} Animated Blackout is a character who appeared in season 3 of the ''[[Transformers Animated]]'' series. He is a homage to the 2007 movie version of the character and incorporates the insect-like style of the movie Decepticons into his robot mode.[http://www.transformersanimated.com/news/7777/First+images+of+Animated+Rodimus%2C+Strika%2C+Blackout+and+spittor Transformers Animated - First Images of Animated Rodimus, Strika, Blackout and Spittor] Blackout is a living legend who has destroyed [[Omega Supreme#Transformers Animated|Omega Sentinels]]. He is also the largest Decepticon ever seen. He can emit shockwaves from his feet that can shut down (and reactivate) machinery. ===Animated series=== He was seen in the season three episode "Transwarped" where he is a member of [[Strika (Transformers)|Strika]]'s Team [[Chaar]]. He was shown to be powerful, but also somewhat dimwitted as unintentionally shut down the Space Bridge his group took for a few seconds. ===Fun Publications=== Blackout's biography was printed in issue #24 of the ''Transformers Collectors Club'' magazine. ===Toys=== *'''''Animated'' Voyager Blackout''' (unreleased) :A new Voyager sized mold, which transforms into an Earth helicopter. The tail rotor becomes a spinning disc launcher in robot mode. Like [[Lugnut (Transformers)|Lugnut]], Blackout is among the shortest in robot height among all the Voyager Class figures in the ''Animated'' line.[http://tformers.com/transformers-sdcc-2009-hasbro-revenge-of-the-fallen-animated-exclusives-panel/12042/news.html SDCC 2009 - Hasbro Revenge of the Fallen, Animated, Exclusives Panel!] *'''''Animated'' TA-20 Voyager Blackout (Takara Tomy)''' (2010) :While the figure was never sold in the U.S, it was released in Japan in 2010 by [[Takara Tomy]].[http://www.tfw2005.com/transformers-news/animated-8/takaratomy-animated-voyager-blackout-image-gallery-169238/ TFW2005.com - Takara Tomy Animated Voyager Blackout Image Gallery] This version sports darker shades of colors and is more detailed than the unreleased Hasbro version.[http://www.tfw2005.com/transformers-news/animated-8/animated-blackout-hasbro-and-takara-comparison-gallery-169575/ TFW2005.com - Animated Blackout Hasbro and Takara Comparison Gallery][http://www.oafe.net/yo/tfan_bout.php OAFE.net] {{-}} ==Transformers: Prime== {{Transformers character| name = Blackout |japanname = |image = |caption = |affiliation = Decepticon |subgroup = |function = |rank = |motto = |alternatemodes = Cybertronian [[space craft]] |series = | engvoice = | japanvoice = }} In the "aligned" universe, Blackout was a battle-hardened gladiator who joined Megatron's Decepticons in the war against the Autobots. His loyalty to Megatron and defiance of Starscream mirror his live-action film incarnation. ===Books=== Blackout appears in the novel ''Transformers: Exodus''.{{cite book|isbn=978-0345522528 |title=Transformers: Exodus - The Official History of the War for Cybertron |publisher=Del Rey Books |year=2010 |author=Alexander C. Irvine}} Blackout was from the Badlands and fought in the pits of Kaon. His body was riddled with scars. He accompanied Megatron to steal the Plasma Energy Chamber from Teletraan-1 and witnessed his battle with Sentinel Prime. When Sentinel Prime fell, exposing the Code Key of Justice within his chest, Starscream attempted to take the Key for himself but Blackout tried to stop him, taking a blow that would've killed any other Transformer but one that only managed to fell him. After Megatron subdued Starscream, Megatron asked for Blackout's name and told him he had a great future. He asked him to take Sentinel's body back to Kaon. He was presumably successful for Optimus Prime later found Sentinel chained to a pillar in the Underworld, having suffered burns from Omega Supreme's takeoff and subjected to even more torture. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [[tfwiki:Blackout (disambiguation)|Blackout]] at [[tfwiki:Main Page|TFWIKI.Net, The Transformers Wiki]] {{Transformers}} [[Category:Decepticons]] [[Category:Fictional helicopters]] [[Category:Fictional henchmen]] [[Category:Micromasters]] [[Category:Mini-Cons]] [[Category:Film characters]] [[Category:Robot supervillains]]

{{Infobox Wrestling promotion |name=Brazilian Wrestling Federation |image = |caption = |acronym=B W F |established=2002 (World Cup Skype) |style=[[Professional wrestling]]
[[Sports entertainment]]
[[Telecatch]] |location=Interior Of São Paulo, Brasil |founder=Bob Jr. |owner=Bob Jr. |formerly= |merged= |website=[http://bwf.com.br bwf.com.br] }} '''Brazilian Wrestling Federation (BWF)''' is a Brazilian [[professional wrestling]] association, the largest in the country. The federation holds one internet show, the BWF [[Telecatch]]. The company was founded with the mission to revive the popularity of [[Pro Wrestling]] and [[Telecatch]] in Brazil. ==History== The BWF was founded in 2002 by Bob Junior. The first televised match was in 2009 and concerts were also broadcast via the official site and [[YouTube]] channel. The company was the first to support a wrestler to compete outside the country. The wrestler Bia fought under the name Bianca in a match at [[Combat Zone Wrestling]] (CZW) in 2003 alongside Sabian, fighting Joker and Mercedez Martinez.{{cite web|url=http://telecatchbrazil.com/v4/?page_id=6434%7ct%C3%ADtulo=Brazilian%20Wrestling%20Federation|title=* BWF - TelecatchBrazil.com |work=Telecatchbrazil.com|accessdate=2015-05-18}} In 2012, BWF became a stage of the “Torneio Sul-Americano de Luta Livre” and in its first year brought wrestlers like Super Crazy and Zumbi to Brazil.{{cite web|url=http://cultura.estadao.com.br/blogs/radar-cultural/campeonato-sul-americano-de-luta-livre-chama-a-atencao-de-visitantes/|title=Campeonato de Luta Livre chama a atenção de visitantes|work=Estadao.com.br|accessdate=2015-05-18}} In 2013, BWF has been more visible in the media. The company announced the participation of [[KENTA]], [[Eddie Edwards (wrestler)|Eddie Edwards]], [[Naomichi Marufuji]], [[Taiji Ishimori]] and other international wrestlers for the "Torneio Latino Americano de Luta Livre".{{cite web|url=http://superluchas.com/2013/02/13/bwf-torneo-latinoamericano-de-lucha-libre-resultados-13-febrero-2013-naomichi-marufuji-vence-a-eddie-edwards/|title=BWF "Torneo Latinoamericano de Lucha Libre" Resultados (13 Febrero 2013) Naomichi Marufuji vence a Eddie Edwards|author=Randall Gordon|work=Superluchas}} On April 27, 2014 BWF debuted a special event called "Convocado Para Lutar" that was attended by [[William Regal]] and Director of Development [[Canyon Ceman]] as part of the assessment of BWF wrestlers for a tryout in [[WWE]]. BWF was present at an [[anime]] convention in 2014 and announced the debut of BWF Rookies, a group of young talents who will form the "new wrestlers" division. In 2015, a new tournament called "Backyard Arena" was presented, and bring some Brazilian independent wrestlers to fight for a BWF contract. The winner of tournament was Death Rider. In 2015 [[Cezar Bononi]], which competed under the ring name of '''V8 Big Block''' and held the ''BWF Rei Do Ringue Championship'' once, was recruited into the [[WWE NXT]] and debuting in 2017 against [[Aleister Black]]. {| class= "wikitable" |+ ! Title ! Champion ! Date won ! Location ! Previous ! Ref |- |Campeonato Brasileiro |Ruriki Jr. |December 10, 2016 |CE Mooca,
São Paulo |Nocaute Jack |{{cite web|url=http://bwf.com.br/site/cinturoes/campeonato-brasileiro|title=Campeonato Brasileiro da BWF|access-date=25 December 2012|publisher=Brazilian Wrestling Federation Site Oficial|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130302044525/http://bwf.com.br/site/cinturoes/campeonato-brasileiro#|archive-date=2013-03-02|dead-url=yes|df=}} |- |Campeonato Sul-Americano |Xandão |May 19, 2013 |Virada Cultural 2013,

São Paulo |Various wrestlers | |} == Roster == {| class="wikitable" |- !Name |- |Acce |- |Beto "Anjo Loiro" |- |Big Boy |- |Bob Jr. |- |Death Rider |- |El Vuante |- |"Espartano" Dillios |- |"Estrela Dourada" Solly |- |Evan Fox |- |Fred Turbo |- |Insano Igor |- |Kabal |- |Matths |- |Maverick |- |Max Miller |- |Michael Fury |- |Nocaut Jack |- |"O Aniquilador" Dante |- |"O Capoeirista" Kid Abelha |- |"O Guerrilheiro" Robson Cruz |- |"O Jovem Fênix" Dinamo |- |O Maestro |- |O Nomade Touaregue |- |"O Rockstar" Blackout |- |"O Sem Noção" Kadu |- |"O Sensacional" Victor Boer |- |"O Superstar" Rapha Luque |- |Sonico |- |Speed |- |"Tenacious" Tim Anderson |- |Toko "Infernal" |- |Tubarão Negro |} ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:2002 establishments in Brazil]] [[Category:Professional wrestling in Brazil]] [[Category:Professional wrestling promotions]]

revision.comment: Bot: Removing [[Commons:File:Chak Phra Festival Surat Thani Thailand 05.jpg]] ([[:File:Chak Phra Festival Surat Thani Thailand 05.jpg|en]]). It was deleted on Commons by [[:Commons:User:Jcb|Jcb]] (No OTRS permission for 30 days).
revision.text:
{{tone|date=October 2016}}
{{Infobox holiday |holiday_name = Chak Phra |type = buddhist |official_name = {{lang-th|ชักพระ}} |image = |imagesize = 250px |caption = Chak Phra Festival in Muang Surat Thani, Thailand |observedby = [[Buddhism in Thailand|Thai Buddhists]] |litcolor = |significance = Celebrates Buddha’s symbolic return to earth at the [[Wan Ok Phansa|end of Buddhist Lent]] |date = 1st waning moon of the 11th lunar month of the [[Thai lunar calendar]] |duration = 9 days and 9 nights |frequency = Annual |date2018 = 21–29 October |relatedto = [[Tak Bat Devo]], [[Wan Ok Phansa]] }}
'''Chak Phra''' ({{lang-th|ชักพระ}}) is a Buddhist festival that is celebrated annually in [[Southern Thailand]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://oservice.skru.ac.th/ebookft/296/%C0%D2%A4%BC%B9%C7%A1%20%A1.pdf |title= Lesson 13: Chak Phra Festival |publisher= Songkhla Rajabhat University |access-date=22 October 2018}}</ref> The named could be translated as “Pulling the [[Gautama Buddha|Buddha]]”, “pulling of the Buddhist monks”,<ref>{{cite book |last=Chadchaidee |first=Thanapol "Lamduan"|title=Essays on Thailand |publisher=Booksmango |date=2013 |pages=5–7 |chapter=Tak Bat Devo and Chak Phra Festivals |chapterurl= https://books.google.co.th/books?id=Zk4dAgAAQBAJ&lpg=PA1&pg=PA1#v=onepage&q&f=false}}</ref><ref>{{cite book |last=Tan |first=Terry |title=The Thai Table: A Celebration of Culinary Treasures |publisher=Marshal Cavendish International |date=2007 |page=24 |chapter=Beginnings: Festival Flavours |chapterurl= https://books.google.co.th/books?id=68UdeYiPeRUC&lpg=PP1&pg=PP1#v=onepage&q&f=false}}</ref> or “pulling of ceremonial Buddha image carriages”.<ref>Yuankoet, Aonta. [http://www.thapra.lib.su.ac.th/objects/thesis/fulltext/thapra/Aonta_Yuankoet/fulltext.pdf "Development and changes in the crafting of Ruea Phra Bok in Kanchanadit District, Suratthani Province"], ''Silpakorn University'', 2014. Retrieved on 23 October 2018.</ref>
''Chak Phra'' takes place on the first day of the waning moon of the eleventh lunar month of the traditional [[Thai lunar calendar]], thus the exact dates of the festival change every year.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.tourismthailand.org/fileadmin/upload_img/Multimedia/Ebrochure/395/SuratEn.pdf |title= Surat Thani E-Brochure (May 2014) |publisher= Tourist Information Division, Tourism Authority of Thailand (TAT) |access-date=22 October 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.tourismthailand.org/fileadmin/upload_img/Multimedia/Ebrochure/670/Thainess.pdf |title= Discover 7 Thainess Gems (2015) |publisher= Tourism Authority of Thailand (TAT) |access-date=22 October 2018}}</ref> In the Western calendar this usually falls in the month of October.
The largest celebration takes place in [[Surat Thani|Muang Surat Thani]] along the [[Tapi River, Thailand|Tapi River]], where the festival lasts nine days and nine nights.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.tourismthailand.org/fileadmin/upload_img/Multimedia/Ebrochure/670/Thainess.pdf |title= Discover 7 Thainess Gems (2015) |publisher= Tourism Authority of Thailand (TAT) |access-date=22 October 2018}}</ref> Smaller celebrations also take place throughout the south including: [[Nakhon Si Thammarat]],<ref>{{cite web|url= https://www.tourismthailand.org/fileadmin/upload_img/Multimedia/Ebrochure/379/nakhonsithammarat.pdf |title= Nakhon Si Thammarat E-Brochure (January 2011). |publisher= Tourist Information Division, Tourism Authority of Thailand (TAT) Nakhon Si Thammarat |access-date=22 October 2018}}</ref> [[Phatthalung Province|Phatthalung]],<ref>{{cite web|url= https://www.tourismthailand.org/fileadmin/upload_img/Multimedia/Ebrochure/384/phathalung.pdf |title= Phattalung E-Brochure (July 2010). |publisher= Tourist Information Division, Tourism Authority of Thailand (TAT) Hat Yai |access-date=22 October 2018}}</ref> [[Pattani]],<ref>{{cite web|url= https://www.tourismthailand.org/fileadmin/upload_img/Multimedia/Ebrochure/608/pattani.pdf |title= Pattani E-Brochure (September 2012) |publisher= Tourist Information Division, Tourism Authority of Thailand (TAT) Narathiwat |access-date=22 October 2018}}</ref> and [[Ko Samui]].
==Etymology==
"Chak" ({{lang-th|ชัก}}) means "to pull"<ref>[http://www.thai-language.com/id/133180 ชัก chak ''thai-language.com'']</ref> and "Phra" ({{lang-th|พระ}}) can refer to a monk, god, or Buddha image.<ref>[http://www.thai-language.com/id/131839 พระ phra ''thai-language.com'']</ref>
==Story==
{{Quote |text=The Buddha’s mother, [[Maya (mother of the Buddha)|Maya]], had died seven days after the Buddha-to-be was born. As she had no access to the Buddha’s teachings, he went up to [[Trāyastriṃśa|Tavatimsa heaven]], where she had been reborn, in order to give her the benefit of hearing the [[Dharma|Dharmma]]. Upon his return to earth, the Buddha descended upon a ladder of crystal accompanied by two Hindu gods who acted as his witnesses and acolytes: [[Brahma]] on a ladder of gold at right and [[Indra]] on a ladder of silver at left.<ref>{{cite book |last= Stratton |first=Carol |title= Buddhist Sculpture of Northern Thailand |publisher=Buppha Press |date=2014 |page=43 |chapter=Chapter 3: Sculptural Conventions, Iconography, Style, Sets, Types |chapterurl= https://books.google.co.th/books?id=EVpSSigMi4cC&printsec=frontcover&source=gbs_ge_summary_r&cad=0#v=onepage&q&f=false }}</ref> |author=Carol Stratton |title="The Legend: The Buddha Descends from Tavatimsa Heaven" |source='' Buddhist Sculpture of Northern Thailand'' (2004) }}
Once Buddha had returned to earth, a large crowd gathered to welcome him. He was offered large amounts of food and was invited to ride in a busabok throne.
==Overview== Chak Phra is assumed to take place in India under the doctrine of [[Brahmanism]] which is popularly uses Buddha statue in a procession on various occasion. Later on, Chak Phra transferred to the [[Southern Thailand]] and has been put into practice and became a traditional festival for nowadays. People believe that Chak Phra will cause rainfall during the rainy season because people who are in the ceremony are mainly farmers.
==Description==
There are two types for this festival. Pulling the Buddha on the land or in the river. Pulling the Buddha Statue on the land is to invite the Buddha statue to the destination which is the temple. This festival is suitable for the temple which is far away from the river. Dragging in the river is to invite the Buddha statue enshrined on the boat and then flock to the destination. This festival is suitable for the temple that is near the river.
===Ceremonial floats===
* land floats ({{lang-th|เรือพนมพระทางบก}}; {{rtgs|''ruea phanom phra thang bok''}}) * river floats ({{lang-th|เรือพนมพระ}}; {{rtgs|''reua phanom phra''}})
{{multiple image|perrow = 2|total_width=400 | align = center | image1 = | image2 = | footer = Ceremonial river floats (left), are brought into Muang Surat Thani via the Tapi River. Ceremonial land floats (right) are pulled through the streets of Muang Surat Thani during the Chak Phra Parade and then put on display for the remainder of the festival. }}
==Customs==
The main activities during '''Chak Phra''' in [[Surat Thani|Muang Surat Thani]] include:
* Putting up donation trees ({{lang-th|ชักพุ่มผ้าป่า}}; {{rtgs|''chak phum pha pa''}}) in front of houses for the Buddhist monks. These donation trees are like Buddhist Christmas trees decorated with money, food, toiletries, and other items that the monks may need. There are over 2,000 registered donation trees around Muang Surat Thani. * Display of ceremonial land floats ({{lang-th|เรือพนมพระทางบก}}; {{rtgs|''ruea phanom phra thang bok''}}) from over 100 local [[Wat|Buddhist temples]] * Pulling of the ceremonial land floats ({{lang-th|ชักพระ}}; {{rtgs|''chak phra''}}) during a morning parade * Long-boat Races ({{lang-th|แข่งเรือยาว}}; {{rtgs|''khaeng ruea yao''}}) * Ceremonial river floats ({{lang-th|เรือพนมพระ}}; {{rtgs|''reua phanom phra''}}) * Colourful displays of the [[Gautama Buddha|Lord Buddha’s]] life cycle ({{lang-th|พุ่มผ้าป่า}}; {{rtgs|''phum pha pa''}}) * Eating the traditional boiled rice snack of “belief & generosity” ({{lang-th|ขนมต้ม}}; {{rtgs|''khanom tom''}})<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.watthasai.net/prapeni_hotom2.html |title= "ขนมต้ม" ขนมแห่งศรัทธาและความเอื้ออารี |publisher= Wat Sai, Surat Thani (Thai only) |access-date=22 October 2018}}</ref>
===Khanom tom===
'''Khanom tom''' ({{lang-th|ขนมต้ม}}; literally ''"boiled snack"'') is a Southern Thai snack made from sticky rice, coconut milk, sugar, and salt. The mixture is wrapped in young [[Licuala spinosa|Mangrove Fan Palm]] leaves ({{lang-th|ใบกะพ้อ}}), formed into a triangle shape, and then boiled or steamed until cooked.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.royin.go.th/dictionary/ |title= Royal Institute Dictionary: ชักพระ (Thai only) |author= Royal Society of Thailand |website= |publisher= |access-date= 23 October 2018 |quote=}}</ref> To show their generosity to those who participate in the Chak Phra parade, the snack is usually made in large volumes by community members the day before the parade at various temples around town, the most prominent being Wat Tha Sai in [[Kanchanadit District]], Surat Thani.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.watthasai.net/prapeni_hotom2.html |title= "ขนมต้ม" ขนมแห่งศรัทธาและความเอื้ออารี |publisher= Wat Sai, Surat Thani (Thai only) |access-date=22 October 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.watthasai.net/pn_horkaotom.htm |title= "ประเพณีห่อข้าวต้มลูกโยน(แทงต้ม)วัดท่าไทร กว่า 32 ปีแห่งการอนุรักษ์ภูมิปัญญาพุทธ ภูมิปัญญาไทย" (Thai only)|publisher= Wat Tha Sai, Surat Thani |access-date=23 October 2018}}</ref>
Outside of [[Southern Thailand]], '''khanom tom''' is usually referred to as "khao tom luk yon" ({{lang-th|ข้าวต้มลูกโยน}}) , as “khanom tom” is also the name of [[Central Thailand]] snack made from glutinous boiled rice balls covered in shredded coconut.
==References== {{reflist|30em}}
[[Category:Buddhist festivals]] [[Category:Festivals in Thailand]]

{{Infobox video game | title = Charlie's Angels | image = Charlie's Angels Coverart.png | developer = [[Neko Entertainment]] | publisher = [[Ubi Soft]] | director = | producer = | designer = | programmer = | artist = | writer = | composer = | platforms = [[PlayStation 2]], [[GameCube]] | released = '''PlayStation 2'''{{cite web |url=http://www.gamefaqs.com/ps2/914966-charlies-angels/data |title=Charlie's Angels Release Information for PlayStation 2 |publisher=[[GameFAQs]] |accessdate=17 June 2013}}
{{vgrelease|EU|4 July 2003}}'''GameCube'''{{cite web |url=http://www.gamefaqs.com/gamecube/542019-charlies-angels/data |title=Charlie's Angels Release Information for GameCube |publisher=GameFAQs |accessdate=17 June 2013}}
{{vgrelease|NA|8 July 2003|EU|25 July 2003}} | genre = [[Beat 'em up]] | modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]] }} '''''Charlie's Angels''''' is a [[beat 'em up]] video game developed by [[Neko Entertainment]] and published by [[Ubi Soft]] for the [[PlayStation 2]] and [[GameCube]]. Versions for the [[Xbox]] and [[Game Boy Advance]] were also planned, but they were later cancelled. ''Charlie's Angels'' is based on the [[Charlie's Angels (2000 film)|first]] and [[Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle|second film]] in the series. It follows the continuing adventures of private investigators Alex Munday ([[Lucy Liu]]), Dylan Sanders ([[Drew Barrymore]]) and Natalie Cook ([[Cameron Diaz]]) as they attempt to solve the mystery of a series of missing national monuments. The heroines do not use firearms but can utilize blunt weapons and certain environmental objects. The game is notable for being panned by critics and has been regarded as one of the [[List of video games notable for negative reception|worst video games ever made]]. ==Gameplay== The gameplay is very simple and involves fighting groups of enemies by performing punching and kicking combinations or by using weapons. Each group of enemies must be defeated before the player is allowed to progress through the game. While the player is engaged in a fight, movement to another area is impossible as invisible walls will block their way. It also featured an option to switch from playing one Angel to another. However, this option is not available during a fight and it is not required to complete the game. Occasionally, one Angel must perform a task such as pressing a switch, pulling a lever or accessing a computer so that another Angel is allowed to progress. Most levels end when all of the Angels have completed their current objective. Unlockables such as trailers and photographs from the movie ''[[Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle]]'' can be unlocked by collecting items such as film reels and memory sticks, which are hidden in each level. ==Plot== {{expand section|date=May 2015}} The game begins on a beach beauty pageant runway. Wearing swimsuits, Natalie and Alex must each individually fight their way from the beach through the community and warehouses to the docks. Joined there by Dylan, the three continue to each fight their way through a series of further locations. ==Reception== {{Video game reviews | GR = 23.74%{{cite web |url=http://www.gamerankings.com/gamecube/542019-charlies-angels/index.html |title=Charlie's Angels for GameCube |publisher=[[GameRankings]] |accessdate=17 June 2013}} | MC = 23/100{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/gamecube/charlies-angels |title=Charlie's Angels for GameCube Reviews |publisher=[[Metacritic]] |accessdate=17 June 2013}} | Allgame = {{Rating|1.5|5}}{{cite web |last=Marriott |first=Scott Alan |url=http://www.allgame.com/game.php?id=42781&tab=review |title=Charlie's Angels (GC) - Review |publisher=[[AllGame]] |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141114145316/http://www.allgame.com/game.php?id=42781&tab=review |archivedate=14 November 2014 |accessdate=9 December 2014}} | GI = 2/10{{cite journal |last=Mason |first=Lisa |url=http://www.gameinformer.com/Games/Review/200309/R03.0821.1128.06673.htm |title=Charlie's Angels |magazine=[[Game Informer]] |issue=125 |date=September 2003 |page=113 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090418151618/http://www.gameinformer.com/Games/Review/200309/R03.0821.1128.06673.htm |archivedate=18 April 2009 |deadurl=yes |accessdate=9 December 2014}} | GameRev = F{{cite web |last=Liu |first=Johnny |date=July 2003 |url=http://www.gamerevolution.com/review/charlies-angels |title=Charlie's Angels Review |publisher=[[Game Revolution]] |accessdate=10 December 2014}} | GSpot = 1.9/10{{cite web |last=Navarro |first=Alex |date=17 July 2003 |url=http://www.gamespot.com/reviews/charlies-angels-review/1900-6071834/ |title=Charlie's Angels Review |publisher=[[GameSpot]] |accessdate=9 December 2014}} | GameZone = 4/10{{cite web |last=Knutson |first=Michael |date=22 July 2003 |url=http://www.gamezone.com/reviews/charlie_s_angels_gc_review |title=Charlie's Angels - GC - Review |publisher=GameZone |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090122095831/http://gamecube.gamezone.com/gzreviews/r21537.htm |archivedate=22 January 2009 |deadurl=no |accessdate=10 December 2014}} | IGN = 4/10{{cite web |last=Casamassina |first=Matt |date=16 July 2003 |url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2003/07/16/charlies-angels |title=Charlie's Angels (GCN) |publisher=[[IGN]] |accessdate=9 December 2014}} | NP = 1.5/5{{cite journal |title=Charlie's Angels |magazine=[[Nintendo Power]] |volume=173 |date=October 2003 |page=140}} | NWR = 1/10{{cite web |last=Shirley |first=Jeff |date=14 October 2003 |url=http://www.nintendoworldreport.com/review/4139/charlies-angels-gamecube |title=Charlie's Angels |publisher=Nintendo World Report |accessdate=10 December 2014}} | XPlay = {{Rating|1|5}}{{cite web |last=Bemis |first=Greg |date=14 August 2003 |url=http://www.techtv.com/xplay/reviews/story/0,24330,3489727,00.html |title='Charlie's Angels' (GCN) Review |publisher=''[[X-Play]]'' |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20030810150330/http://www.techtv.com/xplay/reviews/story/0%2C24330%2C3489727%2C00.html |archivedate=10 August 2003 |deadurl=yes |accessdate=10 December 2014 |df= }} | rev1 = ''[[The Village Voice]]'' | rev1Score = 2/10{{cite news |last=Catucci |first=Nick |date=22 July 2003 |url=http://www.villagevoice.com/2003-07-22/news/monkey-biz/ |title=Monkey Biz |newspaper=[[The Village Voice]] |accessdate=9 December 2014}} }} ''Charlie's Angels'' was universally panned by critics. It received an average score of 23.74% at [[GameRankings]] and an average score of 23/100 at [[Metacritic]]. On GameRankings, the GameCube version of the game holds the lowest score on the site.{{cite web |url=http://www.gamerankings.com/browse.html?sort=1 |title=Browse and Search Games (sorted worst to best) |publisher=[[Gamerankings]] |accessdate=April 30, 2017}} [[GamesRadar]] ranked it as the 50th worst game ever made. The staff commented that the game was even worse than the movie it was based on.{{cite web |title=The 50 worst games of all time |url=http://www.gamesradar.com/worst-games-all-time/ |publisher=[[GamesRadar]] |date=2013-04-15 |accessdate=2013-12-05}} {{clear}} ==See also== * [[List of video games notable for negative reception]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{moby game|id=/charlies-angels|name=''Charlie's Angels''}} {{Charlies Angels}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Charlie's Angels (Video Game)}} [[Category:2003 video games]] [[Category:Beat 'em ups]] [[Category:Cancelled Game Boy Advance games]] [[Category:Cancelled Xbox games]] [[Category:Cancelled Windows games]] [[Category:Charlie's Angels]] [[Category:GameCube games]] [[Category:PlayStation 2 games]] [[Category:Ubisoft games]] [[Category:Video games developed in France]] [[Category:Video games based on Columbia Pictures films]] [[Category:Video games based on films]] [[Category:Video games featuring female protagonists]] [[Category:Drew Barrymore]]

{{Infobox video game |title = Crayon Physics Deluxe |image = Crayon Physics Deluxe cover.jpg |caption = [[Steam (software)|Steam]] header |developer = [[Petri Purho]] |designer = Petri Purho |composer = Stian Stark |engine = [[Box2D]] |released = '''iOS'''
January 1, 2009
'''Windows'''
January 7, 2009
'''OS X'''
August 26, 2011 (Steam)
'''Linux'''
{{vgrelease|EU|August 26, 2011|NA|September 9, 2011}} |genre = [[Video puzzle game|Puzzle]] |modes = [[Single-player]] |platforms = [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], [[iOS]], [[macOS|Mac OS X]], [[Linux]], [[Android (operating system)|Android]]}} '''''Crayon Physics Deluxe''''' is a [[puzzle video game]] designed by [[Petri Purho]] and released on January 7, 2009. An early version, titled '''''Crayon Physics''''', was released as freeware in 2007. ''Deluxe'' won the grand prize at the [[Independent Games Festival]] in 2008. It features a heavy emphasis on two-dimensional physics [[simulations]], including gravity, mass, kinetic energy and transfer of momentum. The game includes a [[level editor]] and enables its players to download and [[User generated content|share custom content]] via an online service. == Gameplay == The objective of each level in ''Crayon Physics Deluxe'' is to guide a ball from a predetermined start point so that it touches all of the stars placed on the level. The ball and nearly all objects on the screen are affected by gravity. The player cannot control the ball directly, but rather must influence the ball's movement by drawing physical objects on the screen. Depending on how the object is drawn, it becomes a rigid surface, a pivot point, a wheel or a rope, and the object can then interact with the ball by hitting it, providing a surface to roll on, dragging, carrying or launching the ball, etc. The player can also nudge the ball left or right by clicking on it, and in some levels, rockets appear and can be used as part of the solution. The game challenges players to come up with creative solutions to each puzzle, and provides additional rewards for elegant solutions that don't rely on "[[brute force method]]s". It comes with more than seventy levels, and also features a [[level editor]] and an online Playground, where players can upload and download custom levels. == Development == ===''Crayon Physics''=== ''Crayon Physics'', the original prototype of this game, is Purho's tenth "rapid-prototype project" inspired by the rules of the [[Experimental Gameplay Project]], and was developed in five days{{cite web |url=http://www.slate.com/articles/technology/gaming/2008/03/crayon_physics_deluxe.html |title=Crayon Physics Deluxe |author=Chris Baker |date=March 19, 2008 |website=[[Slate (magazine)|Slate]] |publisher=[[The Slate Group]] |accessdate=March 30, 2018}} using resources [[Open content|freely available]] under a [[Creative Commons license]].{{cite web |url=http://www.kloonigames.com/blog/games/crayon |title=Crayon Physics |website=[[Kloonigames]] |publisher=Petri Purho |date=June 1, 2007}} The game was inspired by descriptions Purho had heard of the [[children's book]] ''[[Harold and the Purple Crayon]]''. On June 10, 2007, Purho announced that he would be developing a [[level editor]] to permit [[User generated content|user-created]] levels, although by June 15 fans of the game had already worked out the level format and had released new levels for the game. The level editor was released on June 30. ''Crayon Physics'' was built with [[Simple DirectMedia Layer]] middle-layer and released as [[freeware]]. ===''Crayon Physics Deluxe''=== On October 12, 2007, Purho announced ''Crayon Physics Deluxe'', which would feature an intuitive level editor, more levels, and a modification to the game engine to preserve the player's drawings instead of turning them into rectangles. The follow-up took a year and eight months to develop.{{cite web |url=http://npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=99080116 |title=Computer Game A Mash-Up Of Crayons, Physics |website=[[NPR]] |date=January 9, 2009}} It won the [[Seumas McNally Grand Prize]] at the [[Independent Games Festival]] in February 2008.{{cite web |url=http://igf.com/02finalists.html |title=2008 Independent Games Festival Winners |website=[[Independent Games Festival]] |publisher=Think Services |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081105182837/http://igf.com/02finalists.html |archivedate=November 5, 2008 |deadurl=yes |accessdate=March 30, 2018}} Chris Baker of ''Slate Magazine'' also wrote that ''Crayon Physics Deluxe'' was more talked about than ''[[Gears of War 2]]'' at the 2008 [[Game Developers Conference]]. [[Microsoft Windows]], [[macOS|Mac OS X]], [[Linux]] and [[Android (operating system)|Android]] versions of this game were released along with [[Humble Indie Bundle#Humble Bundle for Android 4|Humble Indie Bundle for Android 4]] on November 8, 2012. ===Platforms=== Published by [[Hudson Soft]], ''Crayon Physics Deluxe'' was released for the [[iOS (Apple)|iOS]] on January 1, 2009 and in Spring 2010 for the iPhone via Apple's [[App Store (iOS)|App Store]].{{cite web |url=http://kloonigames.com/blog/crayonphysics/day-1-crayon-physics-deluxe-for-the-iphone |title=Day 1: Crayon Physics Deluxe for the iPhone |website=Kloonigames |publisher=Petri Purho |date=January 1, 2009 |accessdate=January 4, 2009}} A version for the PC was released six days later.{{cite web |url=http://kloonigames.com/blog/crayonphysics/day-7-its-here/ |title=Day 7: It's Here! |website=Kloonigames |publisher=Petri Purho |date=January 7, 2009 |accessdate=January 8, 2009}} An unofficial clone was made for the DS, but only in free play mode and under the title of ''Pocket Physics''.{{cite web |url=http://tobw.net/index.php?cat_id=3&project=Pocket+Physics |title=Pocket Physics |publisher=Tobias Weyand |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081217193516/http://tobw.net/index.php?cat_id=3&project=Pocket+Physics |archivedate=December 17, 2008 |deadurl=yes |accessdate=March 30, 2018}} A port for Windows Mobile was also made, but later pulled. It can still be downloaded unofficially.{{cite web |url=http://pocketnow.com/2010/01/01/crayon-physics-game-pulled-from-samsung-omnia-ii |title=Crayon Physics Game Pulled from Samsung Omnia II |publisher=CJ Lippstreu |date=January 1, 2010 |website=Pocketnow |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100105152739/http://pocketnow.com/software-1/crayon-physics-game-pulled-from-samsung-omnia-ii |archivedate=January 5, 2010 |deadurl=no |accessdate=March 30, 2018}} Ports for Mac and Linux were announced as available on July 27, 2011.{{cite web |url=http://www.kloonigames.com/blog/crayonphysics/crayon-physics-deluxe-is-now-available-for-mac-and-linux |title=Crayon Physics Deluxe is now available for Mac and Linux |website=Kloonigames |publisher=Petri Purho |date=July 27, 2011 |accessdate=November 3, 2012}} Crayon Physics is pre-loaded on some Android devices including the Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1.{{cite web |url=https://www.pcworld.idg.com.au/review/samsung/galaxy_note_10_1/422317/ |title=Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 |website=[[PC World]] |publisher=[[International Data Group]] |accessdate=March 30, 2018}} ==Reception== {{Video game reviews | iOS = true | PC = true | na = true | Destruct_PC = 8.5/10{{cite web |url=https://www.destructoid.com/destructoid-review-crayon-physics-deluxe-116655.phtml page.title: Croatian Association of Theatre Critics and for Theatre Research

revision.comment: Robot - Speedily moving category Cultural organisations in Croatia to [[:Category:Cultural organizations in Croatia]] per [[WP:CFDS|CFDS]].
revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=November 2015}} {{Orphan|date=September 2014}} {{Sources|date=April 2015}} '''Croatia Association of Theatre Critics and Theatre Scholars''' (HDKKT) is a professional, nonprofit organization.
== History == The association was founded on 22 October 1975 at founding assembly in [[Zagreb]] and registered into Civil Association Register on 9 March 1976.
HDKKT is a member of International Association of Theatre Critics (AICT/IACT) and collaborates with The International Federation for Theatre Research (FITR/IFTR). It was founded with goal to develop and promote quality of the profession, cooperation with other similar associations and theatres in [[Croatia]] and abroad and to protect [[Morality|moral]] and material interests of its members. The associations structure comprises: Assembly, Executive Committee and President, Supervisory Committee and Court of Honour. Association first resides in Ilica 42 and later in Amruševa Street 19, Zagreb. It has about 50 active members and 15 retired and since 2013 dance critics are also admitted.
Association is funded by [[Ministry of Culture (Croatia)|Ministry of Culture]]. Shortly after foundation, HDKKT launched Theatrology Library (Teatrologijska biblioteka) with Nikola Batušić as editor in chief and from1979 till 1992 thirty-three titles were published. In year 1994 Theatrology Library merged with Library Prolog (Biblioteka Prolog), former CKD, which was inherited by [http://www.agm.hr/ AGM] (Zagreb). The new library was named Actor′s Booklet Prolog (Glumišna knjižnica Prolog) with editorial board: Nikola Batušić, Branko Hećimović and Igor Mrduljaš. From 1992 till 1997 library published eleven books in cooperation with AGM after which AGM completely took over the publishing activities.
In 80′s association introduced the Award for the Best Play of the Season through members′ survey.
== Demeter's Award ==
Since 2012 HDKKT awards [http://www.hdkkt.hr/index.php/demetrova-nagrada Demeter's Award] for Lifetime Achievement. First one was awarded to one of the founders of HDKKT, president, historian and theatrologist [http://info.hazu.hr/bhecimovic_biography_en Branko Hećimović] 2012, second to secretary general, president, critic and theatrologist [[:hr:Igor Mrduljaš|Igor Mrduljaš]] 2013 and the third to theatrologist, critic, educator and President of HDKKT [[:hr:Boris Senker|Boris Senker]]. The Demeter's Award is awarded on the day of publication of first [[:hr:Dimitrija Demeter|Demeter′s]] criticism about the first professional play in Croatian language Juran i Sofija by [[:hr:Ivan Kukuljević Sakcinski|Ivan Kukuljević Sakcinski]] in journal [[:hr:Danica (časopis)|Danica ilirska]] on 13 July 1840 which is considered the beginning of the Croatian theatre criticism.<ref>[http://www.hdkkt.hr/index.php/demetrova-nagrada Croatian Association of Theatre Critics and for Theatre Research: Demeter's Award for Lifetime Achievement], 11 July 2014</ref>
=== List of Awardees=== * 2012 [http://info.hazu.hr/bhecimovic_biography_en Branko Hećimović] * 2013 [[:hr:Igor Mrduljaš|Igor Mrduljaš]] * 2014 [[:hr:Boris Senker|Boris Senker]] * 2015 [[:hr:Boris_B._Hrovat|Boris B. Hrovat]] * 2016. [[:hr:Vlatko_Perković|Vlatko Perković]] * 2017. [http://info.hazu.hr/hr/clanovi_akademije/osobne_stranice/abognersaban/abognersaban_biografija/ Antonija Bogner Šaban]
== Managing Authority ==
=== Executive Committee === [[Sanja Nikčević]] - President, [[:hr:Alen_Biskupović|Alen Biskupović]] Secretary General, Mira Muhoberac, Antonija Bogner Šaban, Martina Petranović
=== Supervisory Committee === Andrija Tunjić, Goran Ivanišević, Anđela Vidović
=== Court of Honour === Boris Senker, Olga Vujović, Tomislav Kurelec
== Former Presidents and Secretary Generals ==
=== Presidents === [[:hr:Petar Selem|Petar Selem]] (1976-1980), [http://info.hazu.hr/bhecimovic_biography_en Branko Hećimović] (1980-1982), [http://www.enciklopedija.hr/Natuknica.aspx?ID=23339 Marija Grgičević] (1982-1984), [[:hr:Boris Senker|Boris Senker]] (1984-1988), [[:hr:Nedjeljko Fabrio|Nedjeljko Fabrio]] (1988-1991), [[:hr:Mani Gotovac|Mani Gotovac]] (1991-1993), [http://info.hazu.hr/abognersaban_biography_en Antonija Bogner Šaban] (1993-2001), [[:hr:Boris B. Hrovat|Boris B. Hrovat]] (2001-2005), [[:hr:Igor Mrduljaš|Igor Mrduljaš]] (2005-2010) and [[:hr:Sanja Nikčević|Sanja Nikčević]] (2010 - ).
=== Secretary Generals === Giga Gračan (1976-1978), [[:hr:Igor Mrduljaš|Igor Mrduljaš]], Branko Vukšić (1991-1993), [[:hr:Ana Lederer|Ana Lederer]] (1993-2001), [[:hr:Sanja Nikčević|Sanja Nikčević]] (2001-2010), Ljubica Anđelković (2010-2012), Lidija Zozoli (2012 till 13 June 2014), [https://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=251888004&trk=nav_responsive_tab_profile Alen Biskupović] (since 13 June 2014 - )
== Theatre Research Library - list of editions == * 1. Slavko Batušić ''Od Griča do Lutecije'', Zagreb, 1979. ed. Nikola Batušić, for publisher Petar Selem * 2. Frano Čale ''Na mostu Thalija'', Zagreb, 1979. ed. Nikola Batušić, for publisher Petar Selem * 3. Petar Selem ''Otvoreno kazalište'', Zagreb, 1979. ed.
